reusableRoomwideNotable.name: Oasis Cross Room Jump with Screw Attack
note: Use Screw Attack to break the bomb block by entering from a non-water room with a spin jump.
It helps to enter as low as possible and with as much horizontal speed as possible and with HiJump turned off.
Depending on the setup, this may have collision oscillation, making only a 50% success when done correctly.

to.note: This link is only for the X-Ray climb, which skips the junction altogether.
This link is only for the X-Ray climb, which skips the junction altogether.

strats.name: Suitless
devNote: This isn't requiring canSuitlessMaridia because it reduces the likelihood of entering from the top being a logical softlock.
Also it's not very elaborate suitless execution

strats.name: Oasis Cross Room Jump with Screw Attack and Speed through the Top Door
note: Use Screw Attack to break the bomb block by entering from a non-water room with a spin jump, and make it all the way through the top door.
This uses exactly 14 tiles - more rises too fast to do the trick, less does not have the height needed to reach the door.
Use angle to break spin, then a momentumConservingTurnaround as early as possible, right as you pass the above tile horizontally. Using the background for positioning may help.
The second momentumConservingTurnaround is as late as possible, just before touching the above platform.
A third momentumConservingTurnaround is used on the door as it is opening.
strats.devNote: This does not have collision oscillation

to.note: One-way link for shinesparks and cross room gravity jumps. Other strats should go 5 -> 6 -> 4.

strats.name: Diagonal Spark to the Top
strats.note: The spark takes Samus directly to the top platform.

strats.name: Oasis Cross Room Jump with Screw Attack and Speed to the Top
strats.reusableRoomwideNotable: Oasis Cross Room Jump with Screw Attack
note: Use Screw Attack to break the bomb block by entering from a non-water room with a spin jump, and make it to the top.
It helps to enter as low as possible and with as much horizontal speed as possible and with HiJump turned off.
strats.devNote: This does not have collision oscillation

to.note: One-way link for shinesparks and cross room gravity jumps. Other strats should go 5 -> 6 -> 4.

strats.name: Suitless
strats.devNote: This only breaks the bomb blocks but doesnt get up to 6. However the requirements from here to 6 are less than 6->4.

strats.name: Spark to Break the Blocks
strats.note: Spark into the bomb blocks. The trick can fail with 50% probability due to collision oscillation.

strats.name: Oasis Cross Room Jump with Screw Attack
strats.reusableRoomwideNotable: Oasis Cross Room Jump with Screw Attack
note: Use Screw Attack to break the bomb block by entering from a non-water room with a spin jump.
It helps to enter as low as possible and with as much horizontal speed as possible and with HiJump turned off.
Even if executed correctly, the trick can fail with 50% probability due to collision oscillation.
strats.devNote: This only breaks the bomb blocks but doesnt get up to 6. However the requirements from here to 6 are less than 6->4.

strats.name: Oasis Cross Room Jump with Screw Attack and Speed
strats.reusableRoomwideNotable: Oasis Cross Room Jump with Screw Attack
note: Use Screw Attack to break the bomb block by entering from a non-water room with a spin jump.
It helps to enter as low as possible and with as much horizontal speed as possible and with HiJump turned off.
Even if executed correctly, the trick can fail with 50% probability due to collision oscillation.
strats.devNote: This only breaks the bomb blocks but doesnt get up to 6. However the requirements from here to 6 are less than 6->4.

strats.name: Suitless
devNote: Doesn't require canSuitlessMaridia because it's so straightforward.
It's only a separate strat because of how Screw Attack doesn't work.

to.note: This link is only for sparking. All other strats should go 1 -> 4 -> 2.

strats.name: West Sand Hall Insane Bomb Jump
note: Time a bomb to hit Samus when she is morphed, 1 pixel into the sand, inside a sandfall, and moving horizontally.
There is a setup using a sand IBJ to get the right timing, and another setup using a very fast jump morph.

to.note: This link is only for sparking. All other strats should go 2 -> 4 -> 1.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: Evirs will shoot Samus upon entering the room.  It can be avoided by starting on the right side of the entrance and moving left.

strats.name: Gravity Shinespark
strats.devNote: Needs to activate the spark in-room because Samus will bonk if sparking through too low.

strats.name: Suitless Shinespark
strats.devNote: Needs to activate the spark in-room because Samus will bonk if sparking through too low.

to.devNote: This link is only for sparking. All other strats should go 1 -> 4 -> 2.

strats.name: Evir Avoid with Gravity
strats.note: Wait a little bit for the Evirs to descend some before jumping.
strats.devNote: Running in with speed to kill or jump over the Evirs is still a careful jump.

strats.name: Evir Fight Gravity
strats.devNote: Other weapons take too long to kill the enemy.

strats.name: Evir Avoid Suitless
strats.note: By entering the room with run speed, it is possible to jump over the pair of Evirs.

strats.name: Evir Fight Suitless
strats.devNote: Other weapons take too long to kill the enemy.

strats.name: Gravity Shinespark
strats.devNote: Needs to activate the spark in-room because Samus will bonk if sparking through too low.

strats.name: Suitless Shinespark
strats.devNote: Needs to activate the spark in-room because Samus will bonk if sparking through too low.

to.devNote: This link is only for sparking. All other strats should go 2 -> 4 -> 1.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: Enter on the right side of the transition to avoid damage.

strats.name: Fight Evirs with Gravity
strats.devNote: Other weapons take too long to kill the enemy.

strats.name: Fight Evirs Suitless
strats.devNote: Other weapons take too long to kill the enemy.

strats.name: Suitless Evir Freeze
note: Let the Evir descend slightly from its spawn point to be at the correct height.
A power bomb can be used to bring it back up if it falls too far.

strats.name: East Sand Hall Springball Jump
note: On the left side of the raised platform, jump for max height.
Lateral Midair Morph for horizontal momentum, and perform the springball jump the moment before touching the sandfall.
Pause again to disable springball as soon as possible.

devNote: This has no address because this transition doesn't exist in the actual game.
It's just a way for us to avoid duplicating East Pants Room by pretending Pants Room ends at that point.

nodes.note: The center door that is accessible from the grapple block side

nodes.name: Pants Room Junction (Bottom Left)
Pants Room Junction (Above Grapple Block)

strats.name: Pants Room Left-Side X-Ray Climb
strats.note: This climb is left side of the left room - the room with the breakable grapple block.

to.note: This link is only for the X-Ray climb, which skips the junction altogether.

strats.name: Pants Room Right-Side X-Ray Climb
strats.note: This climb is right side of the left room - the room with the breakable grapple block.

to.note: This link is only for the X-Ray climb, which skips the junction altogether.

strats.name: Base
strats.devNote: A 3->4->1 link would simply jump from door platform to door platform.

strats.name: Pants Room Shinespark
note: Preselect Grapple and be ready to use it when entering the room. Release up or angle up before release grapple so the shinespark does not activate instantly.
Use the windup frames for a shinespark to extend the duration timer.

to.note: This link is for strats that go directly to the top of the room. Other strats should go 5 -> 7 -> 2.

strats.name: Base
strats.devNote: A 1->4->3 link would simply jump from door platform to door platform.

strats.name: Pants Room Gravity with HiJump
note: Break the grapple block, then jump on the sand to get through the hole.
Break spin before touching the sand, and then spinjump to get a good jump off of the sand.
Breaking spin after jumping from the sand will remove horizontal momentum, or a stationary spinjump can help.

strats.name: Pants Room Gravity MidAir SpringBall Jump
strats.note: Break spin before touching the sand, and then spinjump to get a good jump off of the sand.

strats.name: Pants Room IBJ
strats.note: Wait for a good jump out of the sand to begin the IBJ with.  A stationary spinjump can help.

strats.name: SpringBall IBJ
strats.note: Springball can keep Samus out of the sand.  Place the first bomb right after Samus begins falling back towards the sand.

strats.name: Pants Room Gravity Jump
note: Gets above the grapple block by doing a well-positioned and well-timed Gravity jump following a good jump off the sand.
It is also possible to do this off of a wall jump on the side immediately followed by a gravity jump.
Break spin before touching the sand, and then spinjump to get a good jump off of the sand.
Breaking spin after jumping from the sand will remove horizontal momentum, or a stationary spinjump can help.

strats.name: Pants Room Suitless MidAir SpringBall Jump with HiJump
note: Requires a mid-air SpringBall jump off the sand.
Break spin before touching the sand, and then spinjump to get a good jump off of the sand.
A stationary spinjump or a turnaround spin jump can help but morphing will remove all horizontal momentum.

strats.name: Pants Room Suitless Flatley Turnaround Climb
note: Use a flatley turnaround jump to get Samus inside the gap during a spinjump.
Samus must jump from the left side platform.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: The swarm of Menus will attack Samus at the top of the room.
strats.devNote: The Menus prevent a reliable IBJ.

strats.name: Suitless
note: Watch for the water level to start falling to time the jump to escape at its lowest point.
Then use SpaceJump to splash on top of the water.
Time another jump with the water level or walljump to fully escape the water.

strats.name: Suitless
strats.note: Jumping from the sand without HiJump is possible, but there is a softlock risk.

strats.name: Avoid Sand
note: Using movement tricks to reduce fall speed even slightly can avoid touching the sand.
A Flatley style turnaround over the grapple block hole reduces fall speed some, but also needs a down back or a tiny jump.
strats.devNote: The or following canFlatleyJump has no logical relevance but indicates there are two distinct ways of using the flatley jump.

to.devNote: This link assumes the grapple block has been broken from below.

nodes.name: East Pants Room in-Room Transition (from Pants Room)
devNote: This has no address because this transition doesn't exist in the actual game.
It's just a way for us to avoid duplicating East Pants Room by pretending Pants Room ends at that point.

nodes.name: East Pants Room Right Door (to Shaktool)

doorEnvironments.devNote: The water level when coming from the larger pants room is below node 2.
The water level when using either door at 2 or 3 goes higher than node 1.

runways.name: Base Runway - East Pants Room Right Door (to Shaktool)
Runway with no Enemies - East Pants Room Right Door (to Shaktool)

nodes.name: East Pants Room Left Door (to Pants Room)
nodes.note: The center door that is accessible from the puyo side

runways.name: Base Runway - East Pants Room Left Door (to Pants Room)

nodes.name: East Pants Room Junction (Below Right Door)

to.devNote: It's expected to take this link by coming from Left Pants Room so these nodes would not be submerged.

strats.name: Suitless Frozen Puyo
note: Involves breaking the top left Puyo free and then freezing it while it falls.
Walk to the end of the door platform and wait for the above puyo to land on the shot block.
It will float there until its next jump, where it will slowly descend.

strats.name: Cross Room Gravity Jump
note: Quickly shoot to break the shot block and then do a momentumConservingTurnaround to ascend into the little region.
Another movement item will be needed to get closer to the crumble blocks.

strats.name: East Pants Room Puyo Clip
strats.note: Freeze the puyo at the start of its jump animation, on the right frame.

strats.name: East Pants Room Suitless Puyo Clip
note: Positioning the Puyo requires it to perform a big jump then start falling with a frame perfect freeze.
One possible setup stands on the left tile of the right side and lets the puyo jump up taking a contact hit.
Then so long as the puyo isn't on the very edge, it will do a big jump.
Clip onto the puyo by doing an aim down jump and switching to a forward diagonal at the right time.
strats.devNote: 1 hit per attempt, 7 for leniency.

strats.name: East Pants Room CF Clip
strats.devNote: Extra 5 cost is just leniency.

strats.name: East Pants Room Suitless Crystal Flash Clip
note: Place a PB up against the crumble blocks, then jump and midair morph into that same position at the end of the explosion while holing CF inputs.
Immediately after the CF, hold down to break the crumble blocks.
strats.devNote: Extra 10 cost is just leniency.

nodes.name: f_ShaktoolDoneDigging
nodes.devNote: No unlock requirements for this event, since just reaching it is enough but the requirements for reaching it depend on where you're coming from

to.note: Entering from the right door gives a weird alignment glitch, but it's possible to exit back through the door and that triggers the event flag, which opens up the room on the next re-entry

nodes.name: Spring Ball Room Door (to Shaktool)

runways.name: Base Runway - Spring Ball Room Door (to Shaktool)

nodes.name: Spring Ball

strats.name: R Jump
note: Roll all the way right before using Xray to stand up, aligned with the right side tiles.
Partially clip into the floor to enable the next jump.
Use an R-Jump to morph into the tunnel.
The second morph ball sized hole can be passed by simply jumping out of the floor clip position with diagonal held.

strats.name: Suitless Space Jump
strats.note: Space jump while partially submerged for more time to mid-air morph.
